job.title: Senior Software Engineer - Remote
job.description: Job SummaryThe Red Hat IT Marketing and Legal team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join us. In this role you will cooperate with local and remote team members and other teams to design, develop, document, test, monitor, maintain, and operate a wide range of public-facing and private software. You will contribute to the team's capabilities by demonstrating technical competence, exceptional communication skills, personal initiative, creativity, desire to learn, transparency, and ability to work as part of a diverse team. Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop, document, test, monitor, maintain, and operate HTTP services and middlewares for internal and external customers, both in the public and private clouds and in dedicated datacentersWork closely with domain experts to analyze and implement business requirementsWork closely with application development teams to standardize build, deployment and operational patterns, tooling, and shared librariesSoftware build and deployment automationResearch and contribute to open source technologiesRequired SkillsAdvanced level of modern JavaScript back-end competencyAdvanced level of PHP competencyExperience implementing integration design patterns, especially in a microservices or event-driven architectureUnderstanding or willingness to learn engineer applications in any programming languageExperience with source control, e.g., GitKnowledge of load balancing methodologyKnowledge of continuous integration (CI) tools and processesUnderstanding build and deployment automation tooling like Jenkins, GitLab CI, Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform, Puppet, or ChefKnowledge of MySQL, MariaDB Server, Oracle, or MongoDBThe Following Are Considered a PlusAdvanced level of modern JavaScript front end competency, preferably ReactBachelor's degree in a technical field; engineering or computer science backgroundExperience with continuous delivery (CD)Knowledge of agile software development methodologyKnowledge of Linux system administrationUnderstanding of global content delivery network (CDN) acceleration and security, specifically AkamaiExperience with TypeScriptExperience with DrupalExperience with SymfonyExperience with Red Hat AMQ, Apache ActiveMQ, or Apache KafkaAbout Red HatRed Hat is the worldâs leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.BenefitsComprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverageFlexible Spending Account - healthcare and dependent careHealth Savings Account - high deductible medical planRetirement 401(k) with employer matchPaid time off and holidaysPaid parental leave plans for all new parentsLeave benefits including disability, paid family medical leave, and paid military leaveAdditional benefits including employee stock purchase plan, family planning reimbursement, tuition reimbursement, transportation expense account, employee assistance program, and more! Note: These benefits are only applicable to full time, permanent associates at Red Hat located in the United States.Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.
